aspect: 1. Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities.
2. Sterling and Ibe were exposed for inhaling the legal high nitrous oxide and smoking a shisha pipe.
3. Rodgers spoke to Sterling and Ibe about their actions in his office and neither will be disciplined.
4. Rodgers wants to draw a line under the matter and focus on steering Liverpool into the FA Cup final.
5. Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa after serving a suspension.
6. Rodgers thinks Liverpool are ready to progress after coming close in the title race and cup competitions.
explain: Manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities. The core idea of this aspect is that Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded two of his players, Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe, about their responsibilities as professionals. It suggests that the manager may have felt that the behavior of these players was not up to the mark, and he needed to remind them of their duties and obligations to the team. This aspect highlights the importance of professionalism in football and how players are expected to conduct themselves in a responsible manner.

The aspect suggests that on top of smoking weed, Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe were also exposed for inhaling the legal high nitrous oxide and smoking a shisha pipe, which showcases their disrespect towards their profession as football players.

The given aspect states that Rodgers spoke to Sterling and Ibe about their actions in his office and neither will be disciplined. This means that the Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers had a meeting with the two players, Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe, to address their behavior off the field, which did not meet the expectations of the club. However, there will be no disciplinary actions taken against them, as the meeting was not a form of punishment, but rather an opportunity for the players to understand the expectations of the club and the importance of their conduct as professional footballers.

Brendan Rodgers wants to put the incident involving Steven Gerrard smoking weed in the past and focus on guiding Liverpool to win the FA Cup final. By doing so, he hopes to bring the team together and put their full energy into the game.
Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard is available to play in the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa after serving a suspension.

Brendan Rodgers, the manager of Liverpool, believes that his team has now progressed to the next level after coming close in the title race and cup competitions this season. He feels that they are in a good position to go further in their future endeavours.
